page.title: 15THE BRITISH SCHOOL,Part 1
page.content: The{British School}is the only nonconformist school in {Gloucestershire.}In the 19th Century chapels did not want their children to go to C of E schools so they started their own schools, calling them British Schools. This school was founded in{1835.}The other British Schools in the County have been closed down or have been joined with County Schools. The school building is owned by the Governors but the County pay the teachers and run the school. This present school is in the area of {Wotton}where most of the new houses have been built. Most of the children come from these new estates. There are 303 pupils--162 boys,141 girls. In the infants--153 four to seven year olds. Juniors--150 seven+ to eleven year olds. 5 infant and 5 junior classes. 10 teachers and 1 headteacher.
